CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

1. DSeBT: This is a material, as it is referred to as a "placement" in the context of the paragraph.
2. Donor (D): This is a material, as it is part of the D-A polymers being constructed.
3. Acceptor (A): This is a material, as it is part of the D-A polymers being constructed.
4. PSCs (Polymer Solar Cells): These are materials, as they are the subject of the study and are being improved by the DSeBT placement.
5. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital): This is a material-related concept, as it is a property of the D-A polymers.
6. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital): This is a material-related concept, as it is a property of the D-A polymers.

Therefore, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are DSeBT, donor (D), acceptor (A), PSCs, LUMO, and HOMO.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. DSeBT
2. donor (D)
3. acceptor (A)
4. PSCs

These are the entities that clearly refer to Material Names in the paragraph. The other entities, LUMO and HOMO, are material-related concepts but not Material Names themselves.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DSeBT |
| donor (D) |
| acceptor (A) |
| PSCs |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

1. DSeBT placement: This is a "Property Name" entity as it refers to a specific property or characteristic of the construction of donor-acceptor polymers.
2. higher J SC values: "J SC" is a property name referring to the short-circuit current density in photovoltaic cells. Therefore, "higher J SC values" is also a property name.
3. V OC values: "VOC" is a property name referring to the open-circuit voltage in photovoltaic cells. Therefore, "VOC values" is also a property name.
4. selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO): "LUMO" is a property name referring to the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital in a molecule. Therefore, "selective lower - lying LUMO" is also a property name.
5. HOMO being almost unchanged: "HOMO" is a property name referring to the highest occupied molecular orbital in a molecule. Therefore, "HOMO being almost unchanged" is also a property name.
6. effective broadening on the absorption band: "Absorption band" is a property name referring to the range of wavelengths that a material can absorb. Therefore, "effective broadening on the absorption band" is also a property name.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. DSeBT placement
2. higher J SC values
3. V OC values
4. selective lower - lying LUMO
5. HOMO being almost unchanged
6. effective broadening on the absorption band

These entities clearly refer to material properties and are relevant to the context of the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| DSeBT placement |
| higher J SC values |
| V OC values |
| selective lower - lying LUMO |
| HOMO being almost unchanged |
| effective broadening on the absorption band |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

1. "higher J SC" - J SC refers to short-circuit current density, which is a measure of the current generated by a solar cell under short-circuit conditions. Here, "higher" is the property value.
2. "V OC values" - VOC refers to open-circuit voltage, which is the maximum voltage that can be generated by a solar cell. Here, "higher" is the property value.
3. "selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO )" - LUMO refers to the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital in a material. Here, "selective lower" is the property value.
4. "HOMO being almost unchanged" - HOMO refers to the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital in a material. Here, "almost unchanged" is the property value.
5. "effective broadening on the absorption band" - The absorption band refers to the range of wavelengths that a material can absorb. Here, "effective broadening" is the property value.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Higher J SC (J SC refers to short-circuit current density)
2. Higher V OC values (VOC refers to open-circuit voltage)
3. Selective lower LUMO (LUMO refers to the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital)
4. HOMO being almost unchanged (HOMO refers to the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital)
5. Effective broadening on the absorption band (absorption band refers to the range of wavelengths that a material can absorb)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| higher J SC |
| higher V OC values |
| selective lower LUMO |
| HOMO being almost unchanged |
| effective broadening on the absorption band |
